title: Superprocess
summary: An ( ξ , d , β ) {\displaystyle (\xi ,d,\beta )} -superprocess, X ( t , d x ) {\displaystyle X(t,dx)} , within mathematics probability theory is a stochastic process on R × R d {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} \times \mathbb {R} ^{d}} that is usually constructed as a special limit of near-critical branching diffusions.
